summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing travel approval and logistics for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, related to the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails reference prior travel for interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach for the same case.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.role: Legal Assistant, Public Corruption, U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY)
persons.context: Coordinates travel arrangements, including flights and hotels, for the investigation team traveling to Sweden for an interview.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Approves travel requests for the Epstein investigation team for trips to Sweden, Los Angeles, and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Copied on the initial travel approval request email for the Sweden trip.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on multiple travel approval request emails for trips related to the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Alleyne seeks Tyrrell's approval for travel expenses and informs him of logistical issues, such as hotels exceeding per diem.
Both are copied on internal emails regarding travel for the Epstein investigation, indicating they are part of the same office team.
Tyrrell is the approving official for travel requests that involve Duncan as a potential team member for interviews.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm, Sweden
events.description: The investigation team plans to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, to conduct an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel for an interview in Los Angeles related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel for an interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel for a victim interview in Los Angeles related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating the Epstein case (2018R01618) as of January 2020, planning an international interview in Stockholm, Sweden.
The investigation involved multiple domestic trips for interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale throughout 2019, indicating an ongoing, multi-jurisdictional effort.
Travel requests specifically mention victim interviews, confirming the investigation's focus on gathering evidence from victims of the alleged crimes.
The email chain reveals standard government travel procedures, including per diem limits and the need for supervisor approval (Edward Tyrrell) for expenses exceeding those limits.
The investigation team planned to use hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews during their travels.
